sentence: Here are 3 things to consider if you have most of your money invested in American stocks.
Diversification is key. Holding assets in as many countries as possible is preferable to just one.
A recent paper has shown that the vast majority of American outperformance is because valuations have soared.

It could pay to be patriotic, even though America is only 25% of the global economy, its stocks count for 60% of the global market capitalization. This share has risen by 12 percentage points in the past decade.
Do you think the case for diversification is reasserting itself? And do you think shifting to foreign stocks after their long losing streak might feel risky?
Share your opinion and see others' responses at joinbackchannel.com
